newsitem.title: USA: Computer Associates skids after NYSE delay.
newsitem.headline: Computer Associates skids after NYSE delay.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc shares opened New York Stock Exchange trade Friday with a 10-1/2 point decline to 51-1/2 after warning about weakness in quarterly revenues.
The NYSE delayed CA's share opening for 45 minutes because of an imbalance in orders, it said.
After trading for about 20 minutes, the shares settled into the 50-1/2 to 50-3/4 range in unusually vigorous trade.
Despite the delay, CA was the most active NYSE issue with almost five million shares traded at midmorning.
The company said softness in the European market will cause revenues for the third quarter ending December 31 to come in below Wall Street estimates.
The company said it expects to post revenues of between $1 billion and $1.1 billion, rather than the consensus estimate of $1.2 billion.
Despite the revenues projection, the company said in a statement that consensus estimates of $0.75 per share for the quarter "appeared achievable."
